actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights

official_title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States relating to the means for establishing appropriate compensation levels for Members of Congress.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Prohibits an increase in compensation for Members of Congress, with respect to any period, from exceeding the net increase in benefits under title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act taking effect during such period as the result of cost-of-living adjustments.

titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States relating to the means for establishing appropriate compensation levels for Members of Congress.
